report_title: Plastic Products Miscellaneous Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Miscellaneous plastic product manufacturers rely on diverse downstream markets. For example, automotive manufacturers purchase various plastic components for vehicle interiors and engine units. In contrast, hardware and home improvement wholesalers buy construction materials, plumbing fixtures and plastic flooring, among other items, to sell to downstream customers, like contractors and consumers. Manufacturers endured global uncertainty and weak manufacturing needs during the COVID-19 pandemic, leading to sharp declines. However, production swiftly resumed in 2021 amid economic stimulus. While the industry faltered again in 2022 because of weak downstream demand, it has continued its upward climb. Revenue is expected to climb at a CAGR of 0.6% to $130.5 billion through the end of 2024, including an expected 0.9% hike in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Pandemic regulations also restricted travel, forcing automobile and aircraft manufacturers to cut production; the entire transportation sector faced a severe downturn. These manufacturers integrate miscellaneous plastic products into vehicle bodies, interiors, electronic components and even GPS systems.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Home Improvement and Housing Markets Temporarily Salvaged Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: While the pandemic slashed the need for plastics from most key markets, residential construction activity soared. In particular, housing starts skyrocketed as many individuals migrated from large cities to the suburbs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Nonresidential Construction Markets Also Struggled to Sustain Growth Figures
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Remote work opportunities led to high office vacancy rates, discouraging companies from funding new projects. Even so, residential construction and packaging markets carried manufacturers through the pandemic.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: RISING INTEREST RATES CUT GROWTH FROM CONSTRUCTION MARKETS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Many contractors specialize in building materials for construction markets; climbing interest rates have prevented most contractors and companies from funding new projects.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-COMMERCE GROWTH CREATES OPPORTUNITIES IN SHIPPING INDUSTRIES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Most brick-and-mortar stores closed during the pandemic, pushing consumers to shop online and fueling e-commerce growth.

industry_definition: This industry comprises companies that manufacture various plastic products, including housewares, building materials, motor vehicle parts, resilient floor coverings and appliance parts. This industry excludes plastic film, sheets, bags, profile shapes, pipes, pipe fittings, laminates, foam products and bottles.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - New car sales

key_trends: Manufacturers face climbing competition from low-cost imports.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Hardware and home improvement wholesalers account for the industry's largest market.
These manufacturers purchase plastic products and components for motor vehicle interiors and some engine components.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Fabricated Plastic Products for Consumer, Industrial, Institutional and Commercial Applications
products_and_services.product_description: Commercial, industrial, institutional and consumer plastic products cover a wide range of products, including plastic utensils, furniture, gears, pumps and other industrial machinery.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Fabricated Plastic Products for Transportation Applications
products_and_services.product_description: Auto manufacturers have increased their use of lighter materials, mainly fabricated plastic, to reduce vehicle weight and fuel consumption, driving the need for this segment.

tier_1_suppliers: Plastic & Resin Manufacturing in the US
Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_1_buyers: Inorganic Chemical Manufacturing in the US

tier_2_buyers: Car & Automobile Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Automakers are one of the largest markets for plastic product manufacturers.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Chinese producers have overwhelmed domestic manufacturers.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region is a manufacturing hub of the US.
The Southeast is the most populous region in the country.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Plastic products manufacturers must comply with federal, state and local air emission legislation.

basis_points.basis_description: Companies rely on innovation to improve production capacity.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Prominent manufacturers have tried reaffirming positions through mergers and acquisitions.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Manufacturers spend the most on purchases
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Manufacturers are sensitive to raw material prices.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Companies need skilled workers for production.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Many manufacturers produce fabricated plastic for buildings.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries such as China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Companies in this industry endure intense competition from imports.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: As this industry depends on the health of automotive and construction sectors.
